page.title: 16The Jumbulance, Harpenden
page.content: The Jumbulance is a 24 ton articulated coach, specially fitted with 18 stretcher-beds, it carries emergency medical equipment & a hydraulic lift. Nurse Salvesen, who works in a Harpenden surgery, set up the local branch. She told us how, each year since 1981, they have taken up to 18 severely ill patients abroad on holiday, this year they go to Italy. The 60' coach has a kitchen in the central concertina section. The 26 voluntary helpers include a doctor, 4 nurses, a priest and 2 drivers. Wheel chairs are carried beneath the coach. Each person is allowed 2 suitcases. Funds raised pay for the patients' holidays but the helpers pay (Â£325) for themselves. The coach is so large that once, in an emergency, they had to pay Â£25 for a mini-ambulance just to get a patient into hospital.
